post.body: My money's on the other 5%
Ouch! Sorry to hear about your basement flooding - hope things aren't too bad.
I am planning a clothes swap for sometime in mid-to-late Jan. Hold your closet excess until then!
The amount of useless-to-us stuff we've found is terrifying! Two people do not require 6 toolboxes, unless one is a carpenter.
AMUSE ME
Yikes! Welcome to the joys of a Newfie Xmas. Island + Winter Weather + Lots of Travellers = Giant Mess.
Where the glass is half-empty of water, it's half-full of air. I need both to survive.
I have a mild hangover and a filthy jester hat that smells like 15 years of booze, smoke and dancing. G'night, good sir, the day has come.
Boots first, then corset! Has it really been long enough that I've forgotten the basics?
Getting ready for one last kick at the Killing Floor: http://tinyurl.com/6eh3dz
Finding a pair of plain black wide-legged pants should not have been that difficult.
New blog post: Resolutions http://www.stacyking.com/?p=54
Sharing in the insomnia trend. @_nadine, @pipesdreams, we shall overcome! Or in my case, nap at my desk this afternoon.
Holy toledo! We have a ton of stuff to give away and I haven't even started in on the clothes/fabric/decorating goodies yet (next round!).
Ruthlessly weeding out unneeded possessions; purging stuff is an excellent antidote to the season's consumer tarnish.
Noon office closing for the win! Now for Xmas cookies, family drama and booze-filled chocolates.
Dances for @la_panique ; hopes the office rumors about a 12 pm shut-down are true.
Life is too short to wear boring clothes or deal with boring people.
Digging the TTC Igloo: http://tinyurl.com/866e2s (how-to is here http://www.eyeweekly.com/article/48246 )
Back from Twilight Tea: full of scones, devon cream, good company.
